content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #81408 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
hmm seems somewhat serious, let's see if it gets attention tomorrow. I'll also explicitely ping the windows group because I'm not sure they receive the ping only by labelling an issue
Yeah, to my knowledge they only get pinged when you do @rustbot ping windows

bumping up this issue because Hans Kratz commented that it still persists. We assigned a P-high in February but somehow the issue passed under the radar.

If nothing else happens by Thursday, I think I could I-nominate it for the T-compiler meeting.
I'd say jump straight to I-nominate now. This is I-unsound, so it would be really good for the compiler team to take a look ASAP.
I'm curious, why didn't we make this P-critical?

can't speak for the others, but perhaps I have waited for an opinion from the windows team and then ... lost track of this issue.

I think that lld is not yet enabled by default on Windows (see #71520) therefore issue is not labeled as regression => didnt appear in the T-compiler agenda at the time.
I can speculate (but I might be wrong) that the build configuration in this issue is not impacting users who normally build with default configs
